description.summary: A prominent hill topped by the roofless St. Michael's Tower in Somerset, England, associated with Arthurian legend, Celtic mythology, ley line theories, and Christian pilgrimage. One of Britain's most spiritually significant landscapes.
description.full: Glastonbury Tor is a 158-meter (518-foot) hill that dominates the Somerset Levels landscape in southwest England. Topped by the ruins of St. Michael's Tower, the Tor has been a focal point of legend, mythology, and spiritual significance for millennia. The site is associated with the legendary Isle of Avalon, King Arthur's final resting place, and Celtic traditions identifying it as an entrance to Annwn, the Otherworld. The hill features distinctive terracing that some interpret as a ritual labyrinth. Nearby Glastonbury Abbey adds Christian significance, claiming connections to Joseph of Arimathea and the Holy Grail. Modern theories position the Tor as a major ley line junction. Archaeological evidence reveals occupation from Neolithic times through medieval periods. Today, it remains a pilgrimage site for Christians, pagans, New Age practitioners, and tourists, representing a unique convergence of ancient, medieval, and modern spiritual traditions.

history.modern_era: Glastonbury Tor remains one of Britain's most visited sacred sites, attracting 250,000+ visitors annually. It serves as pilgrimage destination for diverse spiritual traditions, tourist attraction, and focus of ongoing archaeological research. The site embodies tension between historical fact, medieval legend, and modern spiritual interpretation.

notable.name: Execution of Abbot Whiting
notable.description: Richard Whiting, last Abbot of Glastonbury, executed on the Tor during Dissolution of the Monasteries. His death marked the end of medieval Catholic Glastonbury. Some report sensing residual anguish at the summit.
notable.type: Historical event with reported spiritual residue

notable.name: UFO sightings
notable.description: Multiple reports of unidentified aerial phenomena around the Tor, particularly lights and disc-shaped objects. Concentration of sightings during 1990s.

notable.name: Energy vortex experiences
notable.description: Visitors report sensations of energy, tingling, altered consciousness, spiritual visions, and heightened intuition, particularly at summit. Concentration of reports at dawn and during equinoxes.

factors: Consistent types of experiences across decades
